title.narrative: 2.6 COVID-19 MEDICAL RESPONSE

description.narrative: New Element, which contributes to Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care (Covid), Nutrition In Early Childhood, Nutrition In Early Childhood (Covid), Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions (Covid), Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Partnerships And Engagement: Public And Private, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Survival and early developmentBy 2022, more vulnerable children in their early years (aged 0 to 6) have improved survival and are nurtured and stimulated for improved early childhood development.

title.narrative: New Element

description.narrative: National response to Covid-19 pandemic was enhanced through UNICEF’s commitment and interventions. The National Deployment and Vaccination plan developed jointly with;MoHP, was used to organize COVID-19 vaccination, mobilize human and financial resources and partnerships. UNICEF facilitated the delivery of 75 million doses of vaccines and procured 25 m auto disable Syringes, 264,000 safety boxes, upgraded 1400 vaccination sites, procure more than 7m of PPEs, rehabilitate 62 health facilities for WASH and train more than 540 health providers and CHWS on proper vaccination. These efforts resulted in vaccination of 43.1 million people amongst 16.8 million are fully vaccinated.;;; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:29/12/2021
